title: Rocket Lab launches BlackSky satellites as it prepares for mid-air booster recovery
summary: A Rocket Lab Electron launched another pair of imaging satellites for BlackSky April 2 as the company gears up to attempt recovery of the rocket’s first stage.

title: Russia asked NASA to end sanctions to save the ISS, but the West didn’t blink
summary: "Sustaining safe and successful ISS operations remains a priority for the United States."

title: Rocket Lab’s Electron launches two BlackSky satellites on 25th mission
summary: Rocket Lab has launched two satellites for BlackSky on the 25th flight of its Electron rocket. The mission lifted off from Launch Complex-1A (LC-1A) at Rocket Lab’s launch site on the Mahia peninsula in New Zealand at 12:41 UTC on Saturday (1:41 AM local time on Saturday).

title: SpaceX launches fourth dedicated rideshare mission
summary: SpaceX launched the fourth in its series of dedicated rideshare missions April 1, placing one relatively large satellite and dozens of smallsats into low Earth orbit.

title: NASA begins critical Artemis countdown rehearsal at Kennedy Space Center
summary: NASA commenced a two-day countdown dress rehearsal for the agency’s huge Space Launch System moon rocket Friday, with clocks ticking down to a critical milestone Sunday, when the heavy-lifter will be fueled and pressurized on the launch pad for the first time.

title: NASA to Participate in Space Symposium, Broadcast Select Panels
summary: NASA Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy and Associate Administrator Bob Cabana are among the agency’s speakers at the Space Foundation’s 37th Space Symposium from Wednesday, April 5 to Thursday, April 7 in Colorado Springs, Colo.

title: Forty payloads ride into orbit on SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket
summary: SpaceX launched a German environmental mapping satellite and 39 co-passenger spacecraft Friday, dodging thunderstorms near Cape Canaveral that threatened to keep the Falcon 9 rocket on the ground.

title: NASA Astronaut to Discuss American Space Record in News Conference
summary: NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei, back on Earth after breaking the record for the longest single spaceflight in history by an American, will participate in a virtual news conference at 10 a.m. EDT Tuesday, April 5, from the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston.

title: What Sounds Captured by NASA's Perseverance Rover Reveal About Mars
summary: A new study based on recordings made by the rover finds that the speed of sound is slower on the Red Planet than on Earth and that, mostly, a deep silence prevails. ​

title: NASA’s big rocket faces its last test before launching
summary: "I would be really surprised, in a pleasant way, if the test went off without a hitch."
